meanings.definition: To move or keep at a distance.
meanings.sent1: She tried to eloigner herself from the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent2: The scarecrow was placed to eloigner the birds from the crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to eloigner the toy mouse but ended up playing with it.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range seemed to eloigner the storm clouds, creating a peaceful valley below.
meanings.sent5: The fence was built to eloigner the curious deer from the garden.

meanings.definition: One who or that which removes or keeps at a distance.
meanings.sent1: The eloigner of the family, Uncle Joe, always preferred solitude.
meanings.sent2: The scarecrow acted as an eloigner, protecting the cornfield from hungry birds.
meanings.sent3: The eloigner of the group, Sarah, always sat alone at lunch.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood as a steadfast eloigner, warning ships of dangerous rocks.
meanings.sent5: The guard dog was an effective eloigner, keeping intruders away from the property.
